document.title: Chapter 127. Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Career Development and Career and Technical Education

5BA2209BF8AC48E88A7A5888367772BC.description: assess equipment needs and other resources needed to launch the business.

51536E57D84D444ABC37CBB40A284CBB.description: evaluate insurance costs, locations, and loan terms; and

745D480443C943AE9596231C1F820097.description: research and identify the process for launching a start-up business in the local area;

1DA34DEB23264AF38F176FFC957B12A8.description: The student understands the process for launching a start-up business. The student is expected to:

C1B7BAA24C6542B293B0C444683D92A3.description: provide and receive constructive feedback following a presentation;

42AE15D8439D47D189606F4119855714.description: select and implement effective multimedia strategies for a presentation;

0667324F16B6437AA70906204D079B9A.description: create and deliver a presentation for start-up business funding;

080DEED973C84FB099D640A3352401B4.description: identify the purpose of and present an elevator pitch;

614A027E9B7B4609893661101472C70C.description: The student presents a well-organized business plan. The student is expected to:

55023A95C812422EB4B2D9636AB817DB.description: select and justify key metrics for a start-up business.

72ABEC72D0124EEEB71028D1847CD5D9.description: identify and define common key metrics; and

CEACA4579EE0451EBD723866CAE76393.description: explain the role and importance of key metrics as a measure of success;

20F5225E69A6470186D9945146F38F95.description:
The student understands key metrics to measure the success of a business. The student is expected
to:

88DF886AC665494BB1F2BB00406EF061.description: analyze risks and challenges with supply chain management and distribution.

8E790A0DEA2647309A2965B3F00BB7AC.description: select suppliers for the production of goods and services; and

C01A307C39F04F85B29B8D3612FC4B19.description:
explain how distribution adds value to a product or service by providing place,
possession, and time utility to a consumer;

3C5B69E64E524652AD7EE574ABCCC0C2.description:
determine distribution costs associated with transportation, storage, product handling,
and inventory control;

827E7BCA0C594A138D8763C298021F7F.description:
The student understands the role of distribution and supply chain management for a start-up
business. The student is expected to:

880DA72A56BE4ADC9362D1F9E06BCDF2.description: compare how promotional strategies change during the product life cycle.

B782F8026C7A4B7187D0716470C8956E.description: select an appropriate point-of-sale or e-commerce payment method; and

AA8132C0FE054A3B9DC57B6C3F774E9E.description: explain the role of search engine optimization as a marketing strategy;

A89F781A4BCB4FF186ACEA2DFAD4DCEF.description: conduct a market test to measure promotional effectiveness;

2D683E8166684F2EB1C398E3B11AF056.description: create promotional materials using appropriate technology;

9CF3266F109549E795C11798AA632293.description: analyze customer buying behavior to inform promotional decision-making;

D8FC9D398D014B099885BA6B86FBE676.description:
create a marketing plan for a start-up business that includes the use of internet, social

9878DACCC13B4CB28C09D090E4105A64.description:
The student determines effective marketing and promotional strategies for a start-up business. The

B95E456D3DF4462EB633C62F537FAE47.description: calculate unit economics and a break-even point for a start-up business; and

DF141E65872C4760B1484BA8C67DED3A.description: The student determines a pricing structure for a start-up business. The student is expected to:

65F7ACF260D84075B2B982EA10190B7D.description: explain how company culture impacts recruitment and retention.

B000E43619B149D3995E7F5BC32EEB09.description: create job descriptions for key roles in a start-up business; and

990646C2E3304A0680D2527DBB55EB15.description: create an organizational chart for a start-up business;

70891E2E8ECE4EFAAA5BAF72A2B90D75.description: examine and describe effective leadership and management strategies;

1D89039AEFBC417C9E40176913B8E4CC.description: develop recruitment, hiring, and retention strategies for a start-up business;

E82074DE0F8B40FDA865C608B49AED20.description: explore and identify personal leadership style;

The student understands the impact of leadership, human resources, and management on a start-up
business. The student is expected to:

FD8B52AB36F2480C99802B9619298A2B.description: create the core values for a start-up business; and

33C1A349920E492086902C4BCA5A7E80.description: evaluate the impact of unethical and immoral practices on stakeholders;

CE3292822CE54C3FA29061AA639620C4.description: develop ideas to build a moral and ethical business culture;

8368F38BAC1E4128901974BF0666B6B4.description:
The student demonstrates an understanding of ethical and moral obligations in entrepreneurship as
they relate to shareholders, employees, customers, and the community. The student is expected to:

F38FBD292F444B729F550CA9043B6C85.description: examine implications of sexual harassment and workplace violence on a business.

30B84163489E4B81BEDC5598A29B8DED.description:
create a sample contract for a start-up business such as sales, employment, purchase,
lease, or non-disclosure agreement; and

32E386478B124D589F21E9FFC34B8BBA.description: describe the impact of labor laws when creating a start-up business;

4A29057A8181405C93944A9D09362D58.description: explain the implications of tax laws on a business;

25DA608C406A4AEA9ED8A79D2CC9985A.description: analyze the purpose of legally binding contracts;

E5ACD78D76D9410C95CDA9DE98C4B413.description:
examine the role of workplace safety and health in the regulatory environment and

16102C5BC5CE4B2B97F2A572FC7DF0E6.description:

0550AD5BB4644554AB25D4497C64D039.description: distinguish between the advantages and disadvantages of a patent;

66BD82410C3C49EEB5CCE86715035D89.description:
The student demonstrates an understanding of the legal and regulatory environment for a business.
The student is expected to:

1E57B4A80EF1422F8B32405371C441AA.description: select appropriate accounting tools and services for a start-up business.

BD945067D38E4144B4EE1DB0D615B962.description:
identify accounting tools and services such as accounting and bookkeeping software,

086B211E74374375A8EAE80E7DE3600B.description: create an operational budget for a start-up business;

F9F12C4CE4B24AB1872E77B5E99DBB37.description:
explain the importance of and interrelationship between financial statements, including a

6466AEF8A3324CA697AB7F4220511534.description: identify revenues and expenses for a start-up business;

63CE4D95199C47FCAC788CD46C922199.description: explain the importance of budgeting and cash flow, including burn rate;

9AF4CC990B8A4B4680120395465DAECF.description:
The student demonstrates an understanding of accounting and financial practices. The student is
expected to:

E1904709E1C347D39B860279A13DC22C.description: present a start-up business concept for feedback.

C50F18E3FBE5492AA73B7B19D2633A94.description:
complete the components of a selected business planning tool for a start-up business
concept; and

3A71F57264144BF896E9D6E770DC2908.description: select an appropriate business planning tool for a start-up business;

FCF9EA1171B84BE5A9C596200E0DAEB9.description:
research business plan outlines, resources, and templates such as Business Model
Canvas, lean business model template, or a traditional business plan template;

011CCB7DAC554CCF84CADEEB0C395660.description:
The student uses a business planning tool to develop a start-up business concept. The student is
expected to:

B6090748E9584577BFCC3898D5A28046.description:
explain the process for legally registering and obtaining a tax status for a start-up
business for a selected ownership structure.

7239C8F8BF9343F69D3D00C9AFDA123E.description:
select an ownership structure and explain why it is appropriate for a start-up business;
and

F6AAB43A0EB642FA92ED646FBD6558AD.description: compare ownership structures for a start-up business;

76FFFB7199E14FF896AF347DBC301631.description: The student determines an ownership structure for a start-up business. The student is expected to:

8FC6FD0874C14F6CA6A33B194DA53C8E.description:
evaluate risks and benefits of various funding sources from short- and long-term
perspectives.

BBAA569701154230A207CB26F9383B0B.description: identify predatory lending schemes and practices; and

9F56CB66803E4262BDF5923A5A714EB9.description:
The student understands how to select a funding source for a start-up business. The student is
expected to:

E8A27252AC274BC18E736E53FCA20F2C.description: conduct market testing of the minimum viable product.

D048A6C6261744B78F4F7A4DB8A85A9F.description:
present the minimum viable product, including the unique value proposition(s), for
feedback; and

7A107686ACA749CFAFA16FC9F9610747.description: identify unique value proposition(s) of a minimum viable product;

1727C72345534BE2BE407BDE93F614E6.description: create a minimum viable product to a solution generated from an ideation process;

A1CF58FB3EEC4D4A8B96D6792D85CB19.description: define minimum viable product and unique value proposition for a good or service;

F25A1389A51841B889E6C06BB5A5B1BE.description:
The student creates a minimum viable product (MVP) for a start-up business. The student is
expected to:

0BC4B5125C3D47F79FC8FA18212562CD.description:
select and present the most viable solution to a problem based on market research,
feasibility, and customer segmentation.

031A4F9120C840399B51F2572C27AC39.description:
evaluate the feasibility of possible solutions to a problem, including a competitive
analysis such as a strength, weakness, opportunities, and threats (SWOT) analysis; and

62CC72D935D44ACD80D1F730889D9B1B.description: research, develop, and implement focus group questions for a specific customer segment;

258B7968E1F847ACA17625E08A28E9E4.description: identify the customer segment affected by a problem;

78EA3A2E330C41DFA46D354F18A358F7.description: analyze market research to identify possible solutions to a problem;

A3D05F168BD544EF9F5F8E92CD17309C.description: identify and analyze problems in the marketplace through an ideation process;

E60C59962D754A259FDB42DD987A95D7.description:
The student engages in the ideation process and determines the feasibility of an entrepreneurial
venture. The student is expected to:

08ABEE0509824CF6AEF782BC95558C9F.description: analyze opportunity costs for a given business example.

8FCAB2DAFDD14F2C9CCA066C4DE95A49.description:
self-reflect on and evaluate personal strengths for becoming a successful entrepreneur;
and

7552CDC6CAB944688B0A7E53D977FB5B.description: define scaling as it applies to growing a business;

35B14A89919D41FCAC0469C3F71959AD.description: describe franchise opportunities and ownership requirements;

B3ED23A9C422408E9844C29B7D79DE4A.description: evaluate the factors involved with starting, acquiring, or expanding a business;

10D2F997F91742528320849DFAF2ED05.description:
compare the advantages and disadvantages of corporations, franchises, partnerships,
limited-liability companies, and sole-proprietorships;

5EABFBD07A544C07B863C0F788E7FA5A.description:
The student demonstrates an understanding of the entrepreneurial environment. The student is
expected to:

0437D83A473E4A00998103C5898FC5D8.description: demonstrate virtues, including trustworthiness, responsibility, and good citizenship.

752D4FA256164EB4B02212F91F14CF56.description:
demonstrate critical and analytical thinking skills when comparing business decisions;
and

E1C5A05EA93146B9968E0989ED9C3B51.description: identify appropriate business attire in various work settings;

A6B975D665944FEA9A773E44C94E9DDA.description:
demonstrate coachability skills by working hard, respecting authority, and using
feedback to inform decision making;

F1B57CDE380744D683EC38FB1E9E8D5C.description:
demonstrate leadership skills by participating in career and technical student
organizations, leading a team project, or facilitating a group discussion;

23B27270DBE6487A886D4715342F9BFD.description: identify an ethical course of action in a business setting;

5CD9948C2EBF4DFF981C5052D9FE0C8C.description: demonstrate collaboration skills within a diverse team setting;

E42B7AEF08DE435CA6D47EEA7F05DE9E.description:
demonstrate a productive work ethic by using a personal calendar, task list, and project
management tools;

0D819EA7EFF240078EF96AE34FB3482F.description: demonstrate professional business skills through written and oral communication;

CC8286A703FB47A5B269E85A63361059.description:
The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and
industry. The student is expected to:

68E08DFD7B914EE983635B4E7A3C122E.description:
Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those
containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

612091DBA70B47B08AFFC380A61A13A5.description:
Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and
technical student organizations, local chamber of commerce meetings, and meetings with
entrepreneurs, mentors, or industry experts.

412F8A738C904B318D01FD4B6D0249E0.description:
In Entrepreneurship II, students gain the knowledge and skills needed to become successful
entrepreneurs within an innovative marketplace in a free enterprise system. The goal and outcome
of the course are for students to have a business launched by the end of the course or have the
tools necessary to launch and operate a business. In this course, students learn and initiate the
process of taking a business plan from idea to implementation. Students are encouraged to work in
close cooperation with local industry leaders and community members to develop ideas and
objectives, complete a business planning tool, pitch for funding, and register with governmental
agencies.

BB702913EF3A4106880BB70D20EF59BD.description:
The Business, Marketing, and Finance Career Cluster focuses on planning, managing, organizing,
directing, and evaluating business functions essential to efficient and productive business
management, finance, operations, and marketing.

8DD2320C947B462483658DC70A7B966F.description:
Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic
standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and
succeed in current or emerging professions.

286FE63E61E5424790F01AC2BEB2C9D5.description:
General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 10-12. Prerequisite:
Entrepreneurship I. Students shall be awarded one credit for successful completion of this course.

0B4B7DBD47DA480DB0B3F1FBFE13507A.description:
Implementation. The provisions of this section shall be implemented by school districts beginning with the
2024-2025 school year.
